p: Alkanes and alkenes (compounds 1â€“ 29, Table S1) were reported in A. donax, C. ciliaris, C. dactylon, and S. spontaneum species. In general, 29 molecules from this class were described: 18 in C. ciliaris [ 56, 57], 12 in A. donax [ 43] and only 1 in both C. dactylon [ 58] and S. spontaneum [ 59] ( Table S1). In the first species, these were obtained from its essential oils [ 57] as well as from the lipophilic, methanol and ethyl acetate root extracts [ 56] while in A. donax the alkanes were obtained from the lipophilic extracts [ 43].
